intro: Erigeron scaposus, commonly known as the slender fleabane, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in open habitats such as meadows, prairies, and disturbed soils, often reaching heights of 30 to 60 centimeters. Its leaves are linear to lance-shaped, with rough textures, and its flowers bloom in late summer to early autumn. Erigeron scaposus is known for its ability to thrive in various soil types and its ecological importance as a nectar source for pollinators.
